description: One of the Grade swords and a cursed blade from the Kitetsu school. The sword is said to bring horrible deaths to all its owners. Despite the curse, it is valued at over 1,000,000 Belly due to its exceptional sharpness and quality.
significance: One of Zoro's three most iconic swords. The cursed blade represents Zoro's fearless nature and willingness to challenge fate. It becomes a defining weapon in his arsenal throughout the series.

ownershipHistory.method: Gifted by Ipponmatsu after testing the curse

keyMoments.title: Sandai Kitetsu Revealed
keyMoments.description: Zoro discovers the cursed Sandai Kitetsu among cheap swords in Ipponmatsu's shop.

keyMoments.title: The Curse Test
keyMoments.description: Zoro tests his luck by throwing the cursed sword and extending his arm, proving his luck is stronger than the curse.

keyMoments.title: Gifted to Zoro
keyMoments.description: Ipponmatsu gifts the Sandai Kitetsu to Zoro after witnessing his courage.

lore: The Sandai Kitetsu is the third generation of cursed swords forged by the Kitetsu school. It is part of a lineage that includes the Nidai Kitetsu (Great Grade) and Shodai Kitetsu (Supreme Grade). All Kitetsu blades are cursed and known for bringing death to their wielders, yet they are highly sought after for their incredible cutting power.

description: One of the 50 Skillful Grade Swords. Yubashiri, meaning 'Snow Chaser,' is characterized by its extremely light weight and exceptional balance. It has a black handle with elaborate gold designs, a cross-shaped guard, and a black lacquered sheath with gold accents.
significance: Ipponmatsu's family heirloom and one of Zoro's prized swords until its destruction in the Enies Lobby arc. The sword represents the theme of passing on dreams to the next generation.

properties.grade: Skillful Grade Sword (50 Skillful Grade Swords)
properties.specialAbility: Extremely light weight, exceptional for speed and precision

keyMoments.title: Yubashiri Gifted to Zoro
keyMoments.description: Ipponmatsu gifts his family heirloom Yubashiri to Zoro, entrusting his dream to the young swordsman.

lore: Yubashiri was a family treasure of Ipponmatsu, representing his connection to the world of legendary swords. By gifting it to Zoro, Ipponmatsu passed on not just a weapon, but his dreams and hopes for the future. The sword served Zoro well until it was destroyed by Marine Captain Shu's Sabi Sabi no Mi powers during the Enies Lobby arc, after which Zoro gave it a proper burial on Thriller Bark.
